Intervention: AngioDynamics (previously RITA Med, Inc) radio frequency distribution system (composed of a generator and a Starburst XL probe): generator is connected to a single-use probe. The probe is inserted into the lumpectomy cavity and heated to 100 degrees Celsius and held there for 15 minutes, after which the probe is removed.
Eligibility: Women between 18 and 100 years of age
• Radiological documentation prior to the study of:
Location of anomaly > 1 cm of skin
Grade I-III on the final pathology
No palpable axillary or supraclavicular lymph nodes
In case of prior nonmammary malignancy, survival should be > 5 years without disease.
Previous previous radiation in the breast
- Disseminate microcalcifications (as determined by the investigator)
Results: Number of patients requiring 2nd surgery for close or positive margins

A "firm" surgical margin implies that cancer cells are found on the pathology very close to the surgical margin, and a "large" surgical margin implies that the tumor exists far from the cut edge or the surgical margin. For this study, we defined "close" as less than 3 mm.
Time limit: Margins assessed at Final Pathology, about a week after FR surgery

Description of the arm/group: AngioDynamics (previously RITA Med, Inc) radio frequency distribution system (composed of a generator and the Starburst XL probe): generator is connected to a single-use probe. The probe is inserted into the lumpectomy cavity and heated to 100 degrees Celsius and held there for 15 minutes, after which the probe is removed.
